TopicTitle: Ariane 5 launches 40 minutes after this post. Linky link.

You're welcome Scotius. :^)

Edited December 6, 2014 by Aethon
Whoa! Thanks, dude I missed Orion launch, so it will be nice to see lift-off of one of my favourite rockets. Go ESA!

Awesome, thanks for the heads up.

I just hope they don't have that chick announcer they sometimes have. "The engines, necessary to fight against gravity, pushing the rocket skywards..." Yes, yes, yes, I know. Fire end down, I got it.
There she goes Ariane 5 is so awesome!
Nice launch. First one I've watched live. Very cool!

This was a nice one.

I really like how this guy does the commentary. The whole flow of the webcast is better than NASA I think.

Wow! I've got to say, that is the best coverage of a launch I've seen. To quote Yondas(DK) in the chat room : "NERDGASM"! Way better than NASA, and not one hiccup in the stream.

Truly well done. Kudos ESA!

Nice launch. First one I've watched live. Very cool!

You might get another today; China is launching a Brazilian sat in 6 hours, and the Brazilians are webcasting it. I say 'may' because the site is already down...

Success, two satellites into GTO.

Kryten would you happen to have a link for that?
Separation of both sats successful. Mission is completed. Go ArianeSpace!

Success, two satellites into GTO.

Kryten would you happen to have a link for that?

It's here; or rather it isn't, right now. Launch time=3:26 UTC. I'm not going to bother making a separate thread unless it starts working again.
Whether it works or not, thanks for the the heads up.

Whether it works or not, thanks for the the heads up.
